titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Eva Fiesel (1891-1937) was a visiting professor of linguistics at Bryn Mawr College from 1936 to 1937. She had emigrated from Germany to the United States in 1933 after losing a teaching appointment at the University of Munich because of her Jewish ancestry. Her primary areas of expertise were Etruscan and Indo-European philology.

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised mainly of research notes, largely in German, on the Etruscan language. There are also several reprints of articles by Fiesel.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
